result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy J. Fisher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[MK] case called at 10:48am. 
Defendant Timothy J. Fisher in court, in custody, with Attorney John V Rhiel.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Fisher waives his right to Preliminary Hearing. The Court accepts this waiver and binds Mr. Fisher over. 
Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of  "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified (ADA Hall submits the victim restitution form).  The Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Fisher guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court sentences Mr. Fisher  to 1 year and 6 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1  year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  6 months.  This sentence is to commence forthwith, concurrent.   
The Court finds that Mr. Fisher is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. FIsher is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 0 days credit for time already served.

The Court indicates that the conditions of Extended Supervision are to be set by the Department of Corrections.
The Court orders entry of a civil judgment for the court costs and surcharges. 
The Court orders entry of a civil judgment in the amount of $649, in favor of Walmart [see Walmart-assigned case number and address information on the submitted restitution claim-form].
The Court orders DNA sample provision.

Felony Firearm prohibition/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 11:00am.
cc: DA (electronically & Certified Copy by COC on 3/21/18. sf)

[MA]Case called at 2:35pm
Defendant Timothy J. Fisher appears via video conferencing from Oshkosh Correctional, in custody. His Counsel, Attorney John Vernon Rhiel appears in court .  ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 
Atty. Rhiel requests that a plea and sentencing be scheduled.

recess: 2:37pm

Status conference on March 15, 2018 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on February 28, 2018 at 10:00 am.
Per Court order // Defendant appeared via video

[MK] case called at 2:05pm. 
Defendant Timothy J. Fisher appears via videoconferencing from Oshkosh Correctional, in custody. His counsel, Attorney John Rhiel, appears in court.  DA Susan Happ appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Mr. Fisher verifies that the date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint is correct.
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
DA Happ indicates that, based on Mr. Fisher's current prison-incarceration, the State is not seeking that a bond be set.  
recess 2:09pm. 
[Post-Hearing/Off-Record: the clerk clarifies with the Court that Mr. Fisher has appeared on the Warrant. The Warrant is to be removed from the datebase/cancelled.]

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 2/28/18 at 10:00am  (2) Status Conference on 3/15/18 at 2:30pm.- arrangements are to be made for Mr. Fisher to appear by videoconferencing for this hearing; if Attorney Rhiel determines that the case will proceed to final hearing on that date, then he will notify the Court and the State that a writ is needed  (JA- please note in comments that case is at Preliminary Hearing stage)
Initial appearance on February 9, 2018 at 02:00 pm.

[MK; no record made] 
This case is scheduled for Initial Appearance today.  ADA Monica Hall was present in the courtroom, representing the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense Attorney John Riehl was not present, and court staff had no information about his non-appearance. 
The clerk made a video-conferencing connection with Dodge Correctional Institution, however a person other that Defendant Timothy J. Fisher was in the videoconferencing room. 
Thereafter the clerk indicated to ADA Hall that the hearing will need to be rescheduled. The clerk notes that no victim was present in the courtroom for the hearing.  

NEXT:  reschedule Initial Appearance- arrangements should be made for Mr. Fisher to appear via videoconferencing
Initial appearance on January 23, 2018 at 01:45 pm.

Initial Apperance was scheduled for today. Video connection was made with DCI. Upon inquiry, Mr. Fisher indicated that he has not received a copy of the criminal complaint. Parties were unable to provide Mr. Fisher a copy within reasonable time to accomodate the Court's calendar (as many hearings were scheduled at this time). Court directed that this hearing be rescheduled.
Initial appearance on January 3, 2018 at 01:15 pm.

[MK] case called at 4:15pm. 
Defendant Timothy J. Fisher not in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court discloses that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney and Assistant District Attorney, then- DA Wambach did prosecute or supervise prosecution of Mr. Fisher. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.
The Court finds that probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
The Court orders issuance of a probable cause warrant- body only. 
recess 4:17pm.
